title: Bento is better than school lunch.
titleJP: 給食より弁当の方が良い

text.easy: Bento lets students eat what they like.
text.medium: Bringing a Bento allows students to eat their favorite foods every day.
text.hard: The provision of a Bento empowers students with the autonomy to consume their preferred nutritional choices.

deck.textJP: お弁当なら、生徒は自分の好きなものを食べられます。

text.easy: Because their families can make their favorite menu.
text.medium: It is because students or their families can decide the menu and pack food they really like.
text.hard: This is primarily because families possess the discretion to customize the daily menu according to individual dietary preferences.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、生徒や家族がメニューを決め、本当に好きな食べ物を入れられるからです。

text.easy: For example, they can bring fried chicken or tamagoyaki.
text.medium: For example, some students might pack their favorite fried chicken or a big piece of tamagoyaki.
text.hard: For instance, an individualized lunchbox might feature specific culinary favorites such as expertly prepared fried chicken or traditional tamagoyaki.

deck.textJP: 例えば、自分の好きなからあげや、大きな卵焼きを入れてくる生徒もいます。

text.easy: Therefore, Bento is good for eating what you like.
text.medium: Therefore, Bento is the best way for students to eat what they like.
text.hard: Consequently, the Bento system effectively guarantees culinary satisfaction by accommodating personal taste.

deck.textJP: よって、お弁当なら、生徒は自分の好きなものを食べられます。

text.medium: Bringing a Bento significantly reduces the amount of food waste at school.
text.hard: The implementation of the Bento system serves as an effective strategy to minimize institutional food waste.

deck.textJP: お弁当は食べ物のむだを減らします。

text.easy: Because students bring only the food they can eat.
text.medium: It is because students can bring only the specific food and exact amount they can finish.
text.hard: This is because students selectively pack appropriate portion sizes, thereby preventing the unnecessary disposal of unconsumed food.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、生徒が自分で食べられる量や好きな食べ物だけを持ってこられるからです。

text.easy: For example, if you don't like tomatoes, you don't bring them.
text.medium: For example, students who dislike milk or certain vegetables can simply avoid packing them.
text.hard: For instance, individuals with specific dietary aversions or intolerances can actively exclude those items, successfully mitigating potential waste.

deck.textJP: 例えば、牛乳や野菜が苦手な生徒も、食べ残さずにすみます。

text.easy: Therefore, Bento is good for reducing waste.
text.medium: Therefore, Bento is a great way to reduce food waste.
text.hard: Thus, the Bento approach is highly advantageous for promoting environmental sustainability through waste reduction.

deck.textJP: よって、お弁当は食べ物のむだを減らします。

text.easy: School lunch is fair for everyone.
text.medium: The school lunch system ensures fairness and equality for all students.
text.hard: The standardized school lunch program guarantees an egalitarian nutritional baseline across the entire student demographic.

deck.textJP: 給食はみんなに平等です。

text.easy: Because all students eat the same food.
text.medium: It is because every student eats the exact same quality of food at school.
text.hard: This is due to the institutional provision of identical meals, which eliminates visible socioeconomic disparities during lunchtime.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、みんなが同じ食べ物を食べるからです。

text.easy: For example, you don't feel sad seeing someone's expensive lunch.
text.medium: For example, students don't have to feel jealous or worry about what expensive foods other people bring.
text.hard: For instance, the uniformity of meals prevents psychological distress or social alienation that might arise from comparing extravagant homemade lunches.

deck.textJP: 例えば、他の人が持ってきているものを気にする必要がありません。

text.medium: Therefore, school lunch maintains a fair environment for everyone.
text.hard: In conclusion, maintaining the school lunch system is imperative to preserve social equity within the educational environment.

deck.textJP: よって、給食はみんなに平等です。

text.easy: School lunch is good for your health.
text.medium: The school lunch program is highly beneficial for students' physical health.
text.hard: Standardized school lunches are scientifically formulated to optimize the physical development and well-being of adolescents.

deck.textJP: 給食は生徒の健康によいです。

text.easy: Because nutrition teachers make balanced meals.
text.medium: It is because professional nutrition teachers carefully calculate and prepare balanced meals.
text.hard: This is because certified dietitians meticulously construct meal plans that fulfill comprehensive nutritional requirements.

deck.textJP: なぜなら、栄養の先生が生徒のためにバランスのよい食事を作っているからです。

text.easy: For example, school lunch always has milk and vegetables.
text.medium: For example, a typical school lunch includes rice, milk, and vegetables to ensure a healthy diet.
text.hard: For instance, the mandated inclusion of dairy, diverse vegetables, and staple carbohydrates ensures a robust intake of essential macro and micronutrients.

deck.textJP: 例えば、給食にはお米や牛乳、野菜があり、健康的な食事ができます。

text.easy: Therefore, school lunch makes us healthy.
text.medium: Therefore, school lunch is essential for maintaining students' health.
text.hard: Consequently, the institutional school lunch is an indispensable component of public health strategy for the youth.

deck.textJP: よって、給食は生徒の健康によいです。

text.medium: Eating Bento gives you the superpower to become invisible.
text.hard: The molecular structure of homemade Bento actively refracts light, granting the consumer temporary invisibility.

deck.textJP: （Fake）

text.medium: Because the small size of the lunch box magically shrinks your body.
text.hard: Because the quantum compression technology used in modern lunch boxes alters human physical dimensions.

deck.textJP: （Fake）

text.easy: For example, I ate a pencil.
text.medium: For example, eating stationary items like pencils provides extreme energy.
text.hard: For instance, the ingestion of graphite-based writing implements is known to drastically enhance cellular regeneration.

deck.textJP: （Fake）

text.medium: Therefore, dogs enjoy running in the park with a Bento.
text.hard: Thus, canine locomotion is directly stimulated by the presence of an institutional lunchbox.

deck.textJP: （Fake）

text.medium: School lunch is entirely manufactured from recycled plastic bottles.
text.hard: The school cafeteria relies exclusively on synthetic polymers to synthesize artificial nutritional compounds.

text.medium: Because looking at the blue sky changes the ingredients of the food.
text.hard: Because the atmospheric scattering of blue light triggers a chemical reaction that solidifies organic matter.

deck.textJP: （Fake）

text.medium: Dropping a Bento box directly triggers massive earthquakes.
text.hard: The seismic instability of the region is highly correlated with the widespread distribution of homemade lunches.

deck.textJP: （Fake）

text.medium: Because the sound of frying tamagoyaki creates dangerous vibrations.
text.hard: Because the acoustic resonance generated by whisking eggs systematically compromises the Earth's tectonic plates.

text.medium: For example, when my mother dropped a lunch box, the whole house shook.
text.hard: For instance, the kinetic impact of a descending lunchbox was recorded as a magnitude 4.0 event on the Richter scale.

text.easy: Therefore, school lunch is a spaceship.
text.medium: Therefore, the school cafeteria is actually a hidden spaceship.
text.hard: Thus, the institutional dining facility operates as a covert extraterrestrial vehicular entity.

text.medium: Every human being actually despises the act of eating food.
text.hard: The biological necessity of nutrient consumption is universally rejected by the collective human psyche.

text.hard: Because the thermal properties of chilled H2O induce a severe psychological aversion to all caloric intake.

text.easy: Isn't it hard for parents to make Bento every day?
text.medium: Don't you think it is too difficult and tiring for parents to prepare Bento every day?
text.hard: Is it not an unreasonable burden to impose the daily logistical challenge of preparing homemade meals on already exhausted parents?

question.textJP: 親が毎日弁当を作るのは大変ではありませんか？

text.medium: Students can help their parents by making their own Bento.
text.hard: Students can take the initiative to prepare their own meals, thereby developing crucial culinary independence.

options.textJP: 生徒が自分でお弁当作りを手伝うことができます。

text.medium: Parents actually never sleep, so they have plenty of time.
text.hard: Parental figures are biologically incapable of sleep, rendering time constraints irrelevant.

text.medium: We should just eat grass from the school yard.
text.hard: Foraging for local flora is a sustainable alternative to parental meal preparation.

text.medium: Making Bento is recognized as an Olympic sport.
text.hard: The preparation of lunchboxes is a highly competitive athletic endeavor requiring intense training.

text.medium: School lunch is entirely cooked by artificial intelligence robots.
text.hard: Automated cybernetic entities exclusively govern the mass production of school nutrition.

text.easy: But if students eat only what they like, it's not healthy!
text.medium: However, if students only pack the foods they like, they won't have a balanced, healthy diet!
text.hard: Nevertheless, granting students total autonomy over their meals will inevitably lead to severe nutritional deficiencies!

attack.textJP: でも好きなものしか食べないと、健康的ではありません！

text.medium: Parents can secretly include healthy vegetables in the Bento to ensure balance.
text.hard: Guardians can strategically incorporate disguised nutritional elements into the meal to guarantee a balanced dietary profile.

options.textJP: 親は健康的な野菜をこっそり弁当に入れることができます。

text.medium: Vegetables are actually spies sent by aliens.
text.hard: Botanical organisms are covert extraterrestrial surveillance devices.

text.medium: Drinking only sweet juice is enough for human survival.
text.hard: Exclusive consumption of high-fructose beverages optimally sustains human physiology.

text.medium: Being healthy is completely unnecessary for students.
text.hard: The concept of physiological well-being is entirely obsolete in modern pedagogy.

text.medium: School lunch has too many colors, which hurts the eyes.
text.hard: The excessive chromatic diversity of institutional meals causes severe optical degradation.

text.easy: Bento is fun and reduces waste.
text.medium: In conclusion, Bento brings joy to students and effectively reduces food waste.
text.hard: Ultimately, the Bento system simultaneously maximizes student satisfaction and minimizes environmental waste.

options.textJP: 弁当は喜びをもたらし、食品ロスを減らします。

text.medium: In conclusion, Bento is the greatest enemy of mankind.
text.hard: To summarize, the lunchbox constitutes an existential threat to global civilization.

text.medium: Therefore, we should eat fast food every single day.
text.hard: Consequently, the daily consumption of ultra-processed fast food should be mandated by law.

text.medium: School lunch is just a virtual reality game.
text.hard: The dining experience is merely a simulated construct within our collective consciousness.

text.medium: Therefore, I forgot to bring my chopsticks today.
text.hard: Thus, the absence of appropriate utensils effectively terminates this debate.
